RECORD.TEXT: 180414134 PUOMC 8987576 09/08/1996 12:00:00 AM Unsigned DIS Report Status : NAME : 825-78-07 09/08/96 09/17/96 PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : His abdomen was negative . LABORATORY DATA : He had mild elevation of the WBC intermittently grossly bloody urine . No cultures were positive but the chest x-ray showed bilateral densities more on the left than the right compatible with aspiration pneumonia . His ambulation was minimal and always with assistance but he had a transurethral resection of the prostate on 09/14/96 . He is transferred to Louline Mauikings Medical Center for future rehabilitation and hopeful return home with considerable support and assistance . Aspiration pneumonia bilateral , multiple strokes , chronic atrial fibrillation , prostatic hypertrophy with gross hematuria . MEDICATIONS ON DISCHARGE : Hytrin 2mg at bedtime . Ticlid 0.25 g po bid . Bronchodilators as needed . DOCTOR 'S DISCHARGE ORDERS : Strict aspiration precautions with avoidance of clear liquids and all other liquids thickened . Increased ambulation with assistance and daily pulmonary physical therapy . TR : DD : 09/16/96 TD :
